combinedTechniques.title: Combined Techniques
combinedTechniques.description: In many cases, we achieve the best results by combining different techniques. For example, we can use the FUE method for extracting the hair follicles and then implant them using the DHI technique. This customized approach allows us to find the optimal solution for each patient and achieve natural-looking, permanent results.

methods.title: Sapphire FUE Technique
methods.subtitle: Specialized Technique
methods.description: The Sapphire FUE technique is an advancement of the classic FUE method, using special sapphire blades.
benefits: More precise incisions and less tissue damage
Higher success rate of transplanted hair follicles
More natural appearance of beard hairs
process: Extraction of individual follicular units from the donor area
Creation of recipient channels with sapphire blades
Precise placement of hair follicles in the beard area
methods.idealFor: Ideal for: Fast healing, minimal scarring

methods.title: DHI FUE Technique
methods.subtitle: Specialized Technique
methods.description: The DHI technique enables direct implantation of hair follicles without prior channel creation.
benefits: Higher density of transplanted beard hairs
More precise control over direction and angle
process: Extraction of individual follicular units from the donor area
Direct loading of follicles into special DHI implantation pens
Precise implantation without prior channel creation
Control over depth, angle, and direction of implantation
methods.idealFor: Ideal for: High beard density, precise placement

processSection.title: The Treatment Process
processSection.subtitle: Your path to a fuller beard - Transparent presentation of all steps from initial planning to the final result of your beard transplantation
processSection.expertiseTitle: Our Expertise for Your Perfect Result

advantages.title: Optimal Beard Contour Design
advantages.description: We design the beard contour individually to match the patient's face, taking into account facial shape, age, and personal style for a natural and harmonious appearance.

advantages.title: Invisible Scars with Smallest FUE Punches
advantages.description: By using the most modern and smallest FUE punches, we leave practically invisible scars in the donor area, allowing you to wear your hair short as well.

advantages.title: Minimal Swelling through Reduced Fluids
advantages.description: We use only small amounts of fluids like NaCl during the procedure to minimize swelling and shorten the recovery time.

advantages.title: Precise Placement for Natural Transitions
advantages.description: Each implant is precisely placed to create natural transitions and to respect the natural beard growth direction.

steps.title: Planning
steps.description: In the planning phase, the beard contour is carefully designed and the number of required grafts is determined. A detailed analysis of your donor areas and recipient area enables precise and individualized planning for optimal results.

steps.title: Extraction
steps.description: During extraction, individual hair follicles are removed from the donor area (usually at the back of the head). These follicular units are carefully prepared under the microscope to ensure a high survival rate.

steps.title: Implantation
steps.description: The prepared hair follicles are precisely inserted into the predetermined recipient areas in the beard region. Special attention is paid to the natural growth angle and distribution to achieve an aesthetically pleasing result.

steps.title: Final Result
steps.description: After about 12-18 months, the final result is visible. The transplanted beard hairs grow naturally and can be cut, trimmed, and styled like your own beard. The result is permanent and blends harmoniously with your existing beard.

faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqSection.subtitle: Answers to your questions about beard transplantation - Comprehensive information about the procedure, costs, risks, and results of our treatments

faqs.question: Can I get a beard transplantation if I have little to no beard growth?
faqs.answer: Yes, a beard transplantation is also possible for men with little or no natural beard growth. In this case, the hair follicles are taken from suitable donor areas on the head and transplanted into the desired areas of the face. The result is a natural-looking beard that can be designed according to your wishes.

faqs.question: Are there risks or side effects?
faqs.answer: As with any medical procedure, there are certain risks associated with beard transplantation. However, these are minimal when properly performed. Possible side effects include temporary swelling, redness, mild bruising, or, in rare cases, infections. Our experienced team minimizes these risks through the highest hygiene standards and careful aftercare.

faqs.question: How does a treatment in Germany differ from offers abroad?
faqs.answer: In Germany, beard transplantations are subject to strict medical standards and quality controls. At Dion Hair Clinic, you benefit from the highest medical expertise, state-of-the-art technology, and comprehensive aftercare without language barriers. Unlike some foreign offers, our treatments are performed exclusively by experienced specialists, not trained assistants.

faqs.question: How long does the procedure take?
faqs.answer: The duration of the procedure depends on the number of grafts to be transplanted. Typically, a beard transplantation takes between 3 and 6 hours. For larger transplantations, the procedure may be divided over two days to achieve optimal results and reduce the strain on the patient.

faqs.question: Which method is best suited for me?
faqs.answer: The best method depends on various factors, such as the extent of beard gaps, the quality of donor hair, and your personal preferences. In a personal consultation, we can determine the optimal method for you.

faqs.question: Is the procedure painful?
faqs.answer: The beard transplantation is performed under local anesthesia, so you won't feel any pain during the procedure. After the procedure, mild discomfort may occur, but this can be well controlled with pain medication.

faqs.question: How should I prepare for the procedure?
faqs.answer: For preparation, we recommend avoiding blood-thinning medications (after consulting with your doctor), alcohol, and nicotine for 10 days before the procedure. On the day of the procedure, you should wear comfortable clothing. We will advise you in detail about all further preparatory measures in a personal consultation.

faqs.question: How long is the recovery period?
faqs.answer: Most patients can return to their normal activities after 1-2 days. Redness and swelling usually subside within 5-7 days. Complete healing of the treated areas takes about 10-14 days.

faqs.question: What does the aftercare look like?
faqs.answer: Proper aftercare is crucial for the success of the treatment. In the first days after the procedure, we will provide you with detailed instructions for caring for the treated areas. This includes special cleaning products, sleeping positions, and behavioral rules. Regular check-up appointments at our clinic ensure that the healing process proceeds optimally and your questions are answered at any time.

faqs.question: When can I shave or trim my beard again?
faqs.answer: After a beard transplantation, you should avoid shaving for at least 14 days to not compromise the healing of the transplanted follicles. After about 3 weeks, you can carefully start trimming your beard with an electric hair clipper (not with a razor). After 4-6 weeks, full shaving is usually possible again, but we recommend doing this carefully and with an electric razor initially.

faqs.question: When will I see the first results?
faqs.answer: The first new beard hairs begin to grow after about 3-4 months. The final result is visible after 12-18 months, when the transplanted hairs have fully grown and reached their natural density.

faqs.question: How realistic are the results?
faqs.answer: Modern beard transplantation techniques now enable very natural-looking results. The transplanted hairs grow like your own beard hairs and can be cut, trimmed, and styled normally. Crucial for a natural result are the experience of the treating team, the correct placement of the hair follicles, and consideration of your individual facial features and natural beard growth pattern.

faqs.question: How long does the result of a beard transplantation last?
faqs.answer: The transplanted beard hairs are permanent, as they are taken from areas that are not genetically susceptible to hair loss. They grow for a lifetime like normal hair and can be cut, trimmed, and styled.

faqs.question: Can I color my transplanted beard?
faqs.answer: Yes, after complete healing (about 4-6 weeks after the procedure), you can treat your transplanted beard like your natural beard. You can color, trim, and style it. The transplanted hairs behave like your own hair and grow in a natural cycle.

faqs.question: How much does a beard transplantation cost?
faqs.answer: The cost of a beard transplantation depends on various factors, especially the number of grafts to be transplanted and the chosen method. At Dion Hair Clinic, we offer transparent pricing models and various financing options. In a personal consultation, we will create an individual offer for you.

faqs.question: Are the costs of a beard transplantation covered by health insurance?
faqs.answer: Generally, the costs for a beard transplantation are not covered by statutory health insurance, as it is considered an aesthetic procedure. Some private health insurance plans may offer partial coverage. We are happy to advise you on the various financing options we offer.
